translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions

original: 15.2. Hetuduka, Vedanāttika🔽Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The Section on the Triad🔽With a root-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling as condition there arises what is without a root-cause and associated with pleasant feeling …

original: Nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a root-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling as condition there arises what is without a root-cause and associated with pleasant feeling …

original: Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca na hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a root-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling and with a root-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling as condition there arises what is without a root-cause and associated with pleasant feeling … (In brief.)

analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe pañhā vāram pi
translated: With a root-cause as condition, three … With an object as condition, three … With an absence as condition, three.🔽(The section on the source triad is to be elaborated in the same way as the section on the root-cause triad.)

original: Hetuṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetum dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi sabbattha vitthāro
translated: With root-cause as condition, a state unaccompanied by root-cause and unaccompanied by painful feeling … (In detail as in the case of painful feeling.)🔽With root-cause as condition, a state unaccompanied by root-cause and accompanied by neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … (In detail as in the case of painful feeling.)

original: Hetuṁ adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetum adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā 🔽hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi sabbattha vitthāro
translated: With root-cause as condition, a state unaccompanied by root-cause and unaccompanied by neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … (In detail as in the case of painful feeling.)
